description: The name Sundarbans is thought to be derived from sundri or sundari (Heritiera fomes), the name of the large mangrove trees that are most plentiful in the area.
Bandarban  is a district in South-Eastern Bangladesh, and a part of the Chittagong Division.[4] It is one of the three hill districts of Bangladesh
Cox's Bazar is famous for its long natural sandy sea beach. ... Cox's Bazar has the world's largest unbroken sea beach which stretches more than 120 km.
Sylhet  is a metropolitan city in northeastern Bangladesh. It is the administrative seat of Sylhet Division. Located on the north bank of the Surma River
Sajek Valley  is one of the popular tourist spots in Bangladesh situated among the hills of the Kasalong range of mountains in Sajek union
Dhaka , formerly known as Dacca,[13] is the capital and the largest city of Bangladesh, as well as the largest city in the Bengal region.
